resources.string: Enter text to inject at the start
Enter text to inject when restarting
The "completion" mode generates text to complete a prompt or sentence, while the "chat" mode generates text in a conversational context.
The GPT model to use. Different models have different capabilities and may perform better or worse depending on the task.

The "temperature" parameter controls the "creativity" of the generated text. Lower values will result in more conservative, predictable text, while higher values will result in more unexpected and creative text.
The maximum number of tokens (words or symbols) to generate in the output.
The "TopP" parameter controls the amount of "diversity" in the generated text. Higher values will result in more diverse output, while lower values will result in more repetitive output.
The frequency penalty adjusts how much the model will try to avoid repeating the same words or phrases in the output.
The presence penalty adjusts how much the model will try to avoid including words or phrases that were in the prompt in the output.
The "Best of" parameter controls how many output sequences the model generates, and returns the highest-scoring one.
Text to inject at the start of the generated output, before the generated text.
Text to inject when the model generates multiple output sequences, between each sequence.
A "system message" is a message that is used to instruct the ChatGPT model on how it should behave and any context it should reference when generating a response
